docs.snippet: Robert Mueller, the U.S. Justice Department's special counsel, is specifically authorized to investigate allegations that Paul Manafort, President Donald Trump's former campaign chairman, colluded with Russia to interfere with the 2016 presidentia...

headline.main: Mueller Has Broad Authority to Investigate Trump's Former Campaign Boss

docs.snippet: Investor Warren Buffett's oldest son usually focuses on finding ways for his foundation to help farmers in the developing world or get the most out of the crops he's growing in Illinois. But now Howard Buffett has jumped into the border security d...

headline.main: Buffett Son Criticizes President Donald Trump's Border Wall
headline.print_headline: Buffett Son Criticizes President Donald Trump's Border Wall

docs.snippet: The head of the U.S. Consumer Financial Protection Bureau asked Congress on Monday to trim the agency's power to write rules and spend money.

headline.main: Trump's Consumer Watchdog Proposes to Trim Agency's Power
headline.print_headline: Trump's Consumer Watchdog Proposes to Trim Agency's Power

docs.snippet: Four Marines were killed when their helicopter crashed while they were practicing desert landings in Southern California, the Miramar air station in San Diego said Wednesday.

headline.main: 4 Marines Killed in Helicopter Crash in California
headline.print_headline: 4 Marines Killed in Helicopter Crash in California

docs.snippet: The U.S. State Department expressed concern on Tuesday at the Malaysian parliament's approval of a bill that would allow prison terms of up to six years for spreading "fake news" - an expression frequently used by U.S. President Donald Trump.

headline.main: U.S. State Department Concerned by Malaysia's 'Fake News' Bill
headline.print_headline: U.S. State Department Concerned by Malaysia's 'Fake News' Bill

docs.snippet: Senior Chinese diplomat Wang Yi told North Korea's foreign minister on Tuesday that Beijing supports the North's planned summits with South Korea and the United States.

headline.main: China Tells N. Korea Official Beijing Supports Its US Summit
headline.print_headline: China Tells N. Korea Official Beijing Supports Its US Summit

docs.snippet: U.S. agricultural machinery maker Deere & Co said on Wednesday it would monitor Beijing's new tariff proposals to evaluate their impact on the company and its customers.

headline.main: Deere Says Assessing Impact of Beijing's New Tariffs
headline.print_headline: Deere Says Assessing Impact of Beijing's New Tariffs

docs.snippet: China raised import duties on a $3 billion list of U.S. pork, fruit and other products Monday in an escalating tariff dispute with President Donald Trump that companies worry might depress global commerce.

headline.main: China Raises Tariffs on US Pork, Fruit in Trade Dispute
headline.print_headline: China Raises Tariffs on US Pork, Fruit in Trade Dispute

docs.snippet: Chinese state media on Friday slammed Donald Trump's threat of more trade action against China as "ridiculous" after the U.S President called for an additional $100 billion (£71.3 billion) of tariffs, escalating an already high-stakes trade d...

headline.main: Chinese State Media Slams Latest U.S. Tariff Call as 'Ridiculous' Attempt at Intimidation
headline.print_headline: Chinese State Media Slams Latest U.S. Tariff Call as 'Ridiculous' Attempt at Intimidation

docs.snippet: A group of U.S. states and cities sued the Trump administration to stop it from asking people filling out 2020 census forms whether they are citizens.

headline.main: States, Cities Sue U.S. to Block 2020 Census Citizenship Question
headline.print_headline: States, Cities Sue U.S. to Block 2020 Census Citizenship Question
